Blizzard made Overwatch 2 with the main supposed appeal being the campaign. Players assumed that the 2-3 year content drought in Overwatch 1 was because Blizzard was working on this instead. Blizzard released OW2 with just the PvP promising players that an amazing PvE component was on the way. A while after OW2 launch, they announced that the skill customization feature of the PvE game mode would never make it to production, which was one of the main things that made the whole prospect appealing.

With the Steam release, they also released the INVASION story missions. These are the initial components of the previously promised campaign, just with progression and replayability entirely gutted from  it. However, Blizzard still has the nerve to charge 15 dollars for these 3 missions, and will continue to do so until all of the missions originally intended for the all-inclusive 60$ PvE release are out. All in all, these missions will likely come out to be as, or more expensive than the originally intended product, at a distinctly lower quality and depth than was originally promised. Blizzard made a bad decision, and they are making their playerbase pay for it. Not to mention, the steam release of this game was to compensate for their dwindling player population on their own launcher, a desperate attempt at making their game look more successful to shareholders.

The entire reason for OW2 existence was to change how they monetized the game, under the facade of a switch from 6v6 to 5v5. The battle pass and in-game shop formula was just too lucrative for them to ignore. The currently releasing content is passable for PvP, with relatively consistent hero additions and maps, but it shouldn't be ignored that the upper management is completely out of touch with their developer teams, and constantly wastes developer resources and time, which only serves to hurt the player.

Not to mention, when creating new characters, Blizzard utilizes a "Diversity Space Tool", which aims to take advantage of player's respect for racial, sexual, ability, and age diversity in order to increase profits. introducing a diverse cast of characters is great, but the manner in which Blizzard does it is entirely disrespectful to the groups these characters represent, and makes implications that come off as racist, sexist, homophobic, etc. 

Try as much as possible not to spend money on this game.
I have played Overwatch since 2017; the game fell off hard especially after 2... blame Blizzard kek

Please God bring back Overwatch 1.  Look what they did to my boy :(  This game sucks monster booty hole please Michaelsoft make Blizzard bring back Overwatch 1 I want my game that I paid actual money for back.  Scrap this bullshit Overwatch 2 and make the PvE that everyone wanted.
I can't believe they removed Tracer's schlong.... smh my head
This product is not eligible for refund. All you need to know about Blizzard's faith in their own game.

Let me say that I played Overwatch since Beta and I have hundreds of fun hours playing the game but then Overwatch 2 happened...they took an amazing game away from us and forced us all to play a blatantly obvious money grab. It's literally the same game with a crap ton of new microtransactions. So long loot boxes (which I also paid for multiple times) for leveling up and been a friendly player. Instead you get to pay $10 to get a bunch of crap you don't want and that one skin you really do want. Oh let's not forget the new characters are behind a paywall too. Just when I thought it couldn't get any worse, I reinstall today to play the PVE missions just to find out I have to pay $15 for 3 of them. I quit WoW years ago because expansions got more and more expensive for less and less content, looks like Overwatch is following the same path.
It's better than Team Fortress 2 and I'm tired of pretending that it isn't.

I really wanna see this game in to the glory it once was in, too bad i missed out on OW1. The fact that i just saw a comparison of the archive missions and this current invasion missions i was so disappointed to see that the character selection there was more interactive and cool than whatever we got now, this is certainly a downgrade from OW1 in every single aspect. (I actually stopped playing this game cuz it got boring at a certain point and came back to check PVE only to find out it wasn't worth coming back to)
we want to play it with our own people

This game could be so much better but honestly for what it is, it's still a really really good game. The players are annoying at times but the game itself is very polished and can be borderline (or maybe even actually) addictive. I put over 2000 hours into it since it came out and I ain't stopping anytime soon.
they just changed the name xd
meh overwatch hentai is better then the main game

The game is pretty polished and feels good to play, but its kinda old now. 

OW2 5v5 multiplayer is definitely better than OW1 6v6 [b]IMO,[/b] but that's about the only change that was made. 

Game is not pay to win, so thumbs up for that. 

Don't play this game competitively though, it's not really designed for ranked play. Just pick a hero you like and play for fun.

1) the game is bad
overwatch hasn't been a good game since 2016
it went from a good FPS game to an extremely mediocre strategy game played from a nonsensical first-person perspective
ana was the start of the decline.
also, while OW1 only sold cosmetics (and at very reasonable prices,) OW2 is a pay-2-win game.
it takes ~60hrs of grinding to unlock the new heroes, or you buy them instantly with money.

2) the company is truly awful
activision-blizzard needs to go bankrupt for the good of the industry
never, ever give them a cent

My favorite competitive FPS since Quake 3. The scaling back of PvE is disappointing but as far as competitive PvP shooters go there's nothing better at the moment. Incredible hero design, great competitive modes, terrific maps.

It isn't casual like TF2, something the Diablo style PvE mode was going to address, but for anyone willing to put the time into the competitive mode its the best.
Not bad, a lesser TF2 but a great game and free-to-play. Better than Paladins! Took it a while to get to Steam though.
This game is like ordering the big mac combo meal but only receiving the big mac.

I have over 2,500 hours spread across multiple accounts (most of them being on my main) and have been playing since launch and this game absolutely blows. OW2 is such a disappointing sequel for high level players that I can't even put it into words because it's just not worth my time to do so. 

Wake me up when Overwatch Classic launches within the next 5-10 years.
You are going to hate yourself and everyone around you.

Now take all that good stuff away. The 6v6, great character abilities, lootboxes you can earn in game, good modes, good maps, the list goes on.

Now take all of that way...Welcome to Overwatch 2...

Put simply...Bring back Overwatch 1...please?
